summary: This is an email chain from June 8, 2021, discussing the identification of attorneys who represented Jeffrey Epstein and visited him in prison. A DOJ OIG agent requests help identifying attorneys listed as 'Colon' and 'G. Tali' on an MCC log, and a response lists defense attorneys who appeared in the case and notes that Colon and Tali visited Epstein in jail in connection with his will.

events.title: DOJ OIG Inquiry into Epstein's Attorneys
events.description: A DOJ Office of the Inspector General agent sends an email inquiry seeking to identify attorneys who represented Jeffrey Epstein and visited him in prison, specifically asking about names 'Colon' and 'G. Tali' from an MCC log.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email chain showing the DOJ Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating matters related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and legal representation.
It confirms that attorneys Mariel Colon Miro and Gulnora Tali visited Epstein in jail in connection with his will.
It lists six other defense attorneys (James Brochin, Marc Allan Fernich, Martin Weinberg, Michael Miller, Michael Scavelli, Reid Weingarten) who formally appeared in Epstein's case.
The inquiry stems from an MCC attorney log that was either illegible or listed attorneys by only one name, indicating potential record-keeping issues at the facility.
The response notes that Epstein had dozens of attorneys over the years, highlighting the extensive legal team he employed.
